titleStmt.title: A fountain sealed: or, The duty of the sealed to the Spirit, and the worke of the Spirit in sealing. Wherein many things are handled about the Holy Spirit, and grieving of it: as also of assurance and sealing what it is, the priviledges and degrees of it, with the signes to discerne, and means to preserve it. : Being the substance of divers sermons preached at Grayes Inne. / By that Reverend Divine, Richard Sibbes D.D. and sometimes preacher to that honourable society.
titleStmt.author: Sibbes, Richard, 1577-1635.
Goodwin, Thomas, 1600-1680.
Nye, Philip, 1596?-1672.
Marshall, William, fl. 1617-1650.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Harper for Lawrence Chapman, and are to be sold at his shop at Chancery lane end, in Holborne,

notesStmt.note: Epistle dedicatory (p. [8]-[11] at front) signed: Tho. Goodwin. Philip Nye.
Last line of leaf A3 recto begins "Ladyship".
Portrait of Richard Sibbes on added engraved t.p., signed, Will: Marshall sculpsit.
Title within double-rule border; text within ruled border.
